content:
DescendantMergeIterator Struct

Definition

Iterate over all descendant content nodes according to XPath descendant axis rules. Eliminates duplicates by not querying over nodes that are contained in the subtree of the previous node.

In this Article

[System.ComponentModel.EditorBrowsable(System.ComponentModel.EditorBrowsableState.Never)]
public struct DescendantMergeIterator
Inheritance
Object
System.ValueType
DescendantMergeIterator

Properties

Current

Returns the current result navigator.

public System.Xml.XPath.XPathNavigator Current { get; }
Value
XPathNavigator

The current result navigator.

Remarks

The Current property gets modified when MoveNext method sets the Current property to the next node and returns IteratorResult; otherwise, the Current property remains unchanged.

Methods

Create(XmlNavigatorFilter,Boolean)

Initializes the DescendantMergeIterator. Merges multiple sets of descendant nodes in document order and removes duplicates.

public void Create (System.Xml.Xsl.Runtime.XmlNavigatorFilter filter, bool orSelf);
filter
XmlNavigatorFilter

An instance of the XmlNavigatorFilter class that enables you to filter nodes based on the name. For more information, see XmlNavigatorFilter.

orSelf
Boolean

Boolean that indicates whether the current node is returned as part of the iteration or filtered out.

MoveNext(XPathNavigator)

Position this iterator to the next descendant node.

public System.Xml.Xsl.Runtime.IteratorResult MoveNext (System.Xml.XPath.XPathNavigator input);
input
XPathNavigator

XPathNavigator object that identifies the input node.

Returns
IteratorResult

Returns IteratorResult if there are no more descendant nodes. Returns IteratorResult if the next input node needs to be fetched first. Returns IteratorResult if while iterating through the nodes the stem.Xml.Xsl.Runtime.DescendantMergeIterator.Current* property was set to the next node.
